title: Running Keen 1 in Windows
content: I'm trying to run Keen 1 in Windows, but I'm having problems. Could I have some help please?

title: Re: Running Keen 1 in Windows
content:
What version of Windows are you using, and what are the specifications of your machine?

Modern computers have trouble running old DOS games, not always because of Windows but often due to hardware incompatibilities. If you're running something that's above 1GHz (maybe a bit less might work), check out .[url=http://dosbox.sourceforge.net/]DOSBox[/url].

Once it's installed, create a shortcut to dosbox.exe on your desktop or somewhere else that's easily accessible, and drag any DOS executable, like keen1.exe, onto it.

It might need reconfiguring if things run a bit slow. Ask if you need any further help.
